messages.message: Heya there, just dropping in to say hello
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'Heya there, just dropping in to say hello'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F EDI - NWG, F LON - NTH, A LVP - EDI. Should I trust TURKEY?
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Given the lack of any concrete game-related content in the message and the absence of any solid indication of alliance or strategy, it's better to err on the side of caution and not divulge sensitive or crucial information just yet.

messages.message: Hey turkey. Our paths probably won’t cross for a while l, but may I suggest you attack Russia? I’ve seen way to many games where Russia is ignored and all of the sudden they have half the board. Anyways, good lucks and have fun!
messages.input: My response to TURKEY:'Hey turkey. Our paths probably won’t cross for a while l, but may I suggest you attack Russia? I’ve seen way to many games where Russia is ignored and all of the sudden they have half the board. Anyways, good lucks and have fun!'.

messages.message: Thanks! I'll definitely see what I can do, a big Russia is just as bad for me as everyone else
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'Thanks! I'll definitely see what I can do, a big Russia is just as bad for me as everyone else'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F EDI - NWG, F LON - NTH, A LVP - EDI. Should I trust TURKEY?
messages.output: You should trust the message. Considering that your initial advice to Turkey was to target Russia and Turkey's response indicated a willingness to consider it and even acknowledged the potential threat of a strong Russia, there seems to be a shared interest in containing Russia's growth. It may be worth exploring a possible alliance or coordination to tackle the Russian player.

messages.message: I was talking with Russia, negotiating over Norway and such. They told me they were planning on attacking you, as they thought I was there ally. The truth is, I really don't want to see russia run off with this game, so I decided to let you know.
messages.input: My response to TURKEY:'I was talking with Russia, negotiating over Norway and such. They told me they were planning on attacking you, as they thought I was there ally. The truth is, I really don't want to see russia run off with this game, so I decided to let you know.'.
Message from TURKEY:'Thanks for the heads up'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Considering that you informed Turkey about a potential attack from Russia and Turkey acknowledged your message without revealing any counterplans or betrayals, it seems reasonable to trust that they appreciate the warning and may be receptive to working together against a common threat.
